queries.sql: SELECT 1 FROM `userlogin` WHERE `id` = '1' LIMIT 1
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 1
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 2
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 3
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 4
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 8
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 9
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 10
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 12
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 13
SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 11

WITH RECURSIVE referrals AS ( SELECT id, referedby, 1 as level FROM userlogin WHERE id = 1 UNION ALL SELECT u.id, u.referedby, r.level + 1 as level FROM userlogin u INNER JOIN referrals r ON u.referedby = r.id ) SELECT level,id, COUNT(*) AS node_count FROM referrals WHERE id <> 1 GROUP BY level;

queries.sql: SELECT id, f_name, l_name, email FROM userlogin WHERE referedby = 11
select count(*) from userlogin where referedby=1

WITH RECURSIVE referrals AS ( SELECT id, referedby FROM userlogin WHERE id = 1 UNION ALL SELECT u.id, u.referedby FROM userlogin u INNER JOIN userlogin r ON u.referedby = r.id ) SELECT * FROM referrals where id>1;

WITH RECURSIVE subchilds AS ( SELECT id, referedby, email FROM userlogin WHERE id = 1 UNION ALL SELECT u.id, u.referedby, u.email FROM userlogin u JOIN subchilds s ON u.referedby = s.id WHERE u.id !=1 AND u.referedby != s.referedby ) SELECT COUNT(*) AS TOTAL FROM subchilds where id!= 1 AND referedby !=1;
